page.title: 18HOUSING, BURSTON AREA
page.content:
Although many British villages are dwindling due to lack of amenities, this is not so in Burston. Young couples are buying cottages as they are cheap, whilst nearby towns provide employment within commuting distance. However, we heard complaints from some older members of the community who find these young families are a lot noisier than their elderly predecessors.
The village is unlikely to grow as there are two plans for development control in this area; a Statutory Local Plan and a North Staffs. Plan. As this is a rural area there is a presumption against further development unless a need is proven. If permission is granted for new building it is usually for agricultural purposes.
